sourceDesc.p:
The J.N. Bertram letters are a collection of letters that include personal corrisponse, business corrispondece, and newspaper clippings. The material transcribed in this edition is a sample from those three categories, including handwritten letters, typewritten corrispondece, and newpaper clippings.
Jasper N. Bertram Letters Various Personal archives, unpublished date 4215-001

normalization.p: In an effort to preserve authorial intent of manuscript documents, primarily comprised of letters of correspondence, we have chosen to leave all spelling and grammar errors. This choice was done in order for our edition to reflect the people composing the documents and the time period in which they were written.

punctuation.p: Some letters contain no punctuation at all. No corrections were made to preserve authorial voice.

correction.p: If you discovered errors in your text, you can talk here about where you decided to correct them or not - Errors were left unedited; any mispellings that appear in the text were directly from the source.
